Uses of Class
java.io.Writer

Packages that use Writer
com.codename1.impl The implementation package should not be used by developers, it is an internal implementation detail which will break compatibility between major Codename One releases. 
com.codename1.io Codename One IO is intended as a componentized solution for IO operations that allows us to centralize IO logic while maintaining a more portable approach for threads. 
java.io

Methods in com.codename1.io that return Writer
protected  Writer Log.createWriter()
          Default method for creating the output writer into which we write, this method creates a simple log file using the file connector
 

Uses of Writer in java.io
 

Subclasses of Writer in java.io
 class OutputStreamWriter
          An OutputStreamWriter is a bridge from character streams to byte streams: Characters written to it are translated into bytes.
